definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Alchemy transforms consciousness and transmutes the body through 12 Steps of Evolution.
sentences.chinese: 鍊金術透過十二個進化階段來轉變意識和質變身體。

sentences.english: And according to manager Wenger, Bendtner has improved dramatically over the last month.
sentences.chinese: 而對溫格而言，本特納在上個月可謂發生了質變。

sentences.english: In 2011, quantity will finally turn into quality.
So how would you pursue such a goal as a quantum leaper ?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，你要如何抱着質變的決心來追求這樣的目標呢？

sentences.english: Moving from quantity to quality is the immediate task before us.
sentences.chinese: 從量變到質變是擺在我們面前的首要任務。

sentences.english: After the perishing of the Song Dynasty, the intension of group feature had a qualitative change.
sentences.chinese: 國亡之後，詞人羣體特徵的內涵發生了質變。

sentences.english: Over time, however, these quantitative changes turn into non-incremental qualitative changes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，長期以來，量變並沒帶來質變的遞增。

sentences.english: The results showed that the grain yield and rice quality decreased under the conditions of thin plough layer.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明，薄耕層使米質變劣，產量銳減。

sentences.english: Milos is the man who makes Juve change gear.
sentences.chinese: 米洛斯是一個可以讓尤文發生質變的引擎。

sentences.english: But after the mother-in-law comes, small sweet life begins to produce qualitative change.
sentences.chinese: 但婆婆到來後，溫馨的小家生活開始發生質變。

sentences.english: This cancer cells will survive in the body, and finally from the quantitative to qualitative change.
sentences.chinese: 這樣癌細胞就會在體內存活下來，最後由量變到質變。

definition: variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to accumulate over a long period of time
variant Chinese character/alternative form of a Chinese character
